Package helpers

Class HelperMethods

java.lang.Object
helpers.HelperMethods
public class HelperMethods extends Object
Class that contains utility methods. Does not need instantiation as every method is static.

  • Method Details

    • customParseBoolean

      public static boolean customParseBoolean​(String stringToParse) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Alternative to the default Java Boolean#parseBoolean(String) method. Returns true if the specified string's content is equal to "true". This check is case insensitive. Returns false if the specified string's content is equal to "false". This check is case insensitive. Throws an exception if the strings content is not equivalent to either "true" or "false".
      Parameters:
      stringToParse - string whose content will be parsed for a logic value.
      Returns:
      true if the specified string's content is equal to "true". false if the specified string's content is equal to "false". This check is case insensitive.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided string's content is not equivalent to "true" or "false".
      See Also:
      Boolean.parseBoolean(String)

    • getCaseInsensitive

      public static <V> V getCaseInsensitive​(Map<String,​V> map, String key)
      Case insensitive alternative to the regular Map#get(Object) for maps with String keys. Implemented to make checking for rules/metrics with the same name more user-friendly, while still allowing custom capitalization for table headers when the rule/metric name is shown in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      map - map whose content will be checked
      key - key which will be searched for in the map, to find the corresponding value. This search is case insensitive.
      Returns:
      the first value whose key corresponds to the specified key. There may exist multiple in the map (with keys with differing capitalizations). null if there isn't a matching key in the specified map.
      See Also:
      Map.get(Object)

    • containsKeyCaseInsensitive

      public static <V> boolean containsKeyCaseInsensitive​(Map<String,​V> map, String key)
      Case insensitive alternative to the regular Map#containsKey(Object) for maps with String keys. Returns true if the specified map contains a matching key to the specified key, ignoring capitalization.
      Parameters:
      map - map whose content will be checked
      key - key whose presence in this list is to be tested
      Returns:
      true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key. This check is case insensitive.

    • compareMapCounters

      public static <K> boolean compareMapCounters​(Map<K,​com.codahale.metrics.Counter> map1, Map<K,​com.codahale.metrics.Counter> map2)
      Compares the count for each entry in two specified maps, with #Counter as values.
      Parameters:
      map1 - first map to be used in the comparison
      map2 - second map to be used in the comparison
      Returns:
      true if both maps have the same size and each key corresponds to the same count in both maps.
      See Also:
      #Counter, Map.equals(Object)
